ColourWords.Title: Present Continuous as future
ColourWords.Instruction: Click on the Present Continuous verbs that express the future. Six of the Present Continuous verbs in the text express the future and four express the present.

ContentColourWords.Sentence: I'm 35 and I haven't got a degree, or any other qualification. I'm unhappy about that soI'm startinga course at university in October - I'm takinga course in architecture. At the moment I'm working for some lawyers and I'm really not enjoying the job at all, so I know that I don't want to be a lawyer. I'm leavingthe job in the middle of August and I'm goingon holiday with some friends and their children for the last two weeks of August. Then I'm spendinga week in an architect's office â€“ my best friend is an architect and he's currently running a small business in an office in town. After the week with him I'm visitingmy parents in Scotland. I want a few nice, quiet days to relax before my course starts, and they're living in a small house on a beautiful, quiet island, so that's just right for me!
